mcpServers._comment_github: GitHub integration - issues, PRs, repos, search

env._comment: Create token at https://github.com/settings/tokens with repo scope

filesystem._note: Restrict to specific directories for security. Can specify multiple paths.
filesystem._security: Only grant access to directories that Claude should modify

mcpServers._comment_postgres: PostgreSQL database access - queries, schema inspection

postgres._security: Use read-only database user if possible
postgres._note: Supports schema inspection and SQL queries

sequential-thinking._note: No configuration required. Enables extended thinking mode.
sequential-thinking._use_case: Helpful for complex debugging, architecture decisions, algorithmic problems

mcpServers._comment_brave_search: Web search via Brave Search API

puppeteer._note: Enables Claude to control a browser

mcpServers._comment_slack: Slack integration - send messages, read channels
mcpServers._comment_memory: Long-term memory for Claude across sessions

memory._note: Stores knowledge graphs that persist across Claude sessions

sqlite._note: Simpler alternative to PostgreSQL for local databases

env._comment: OAuth credentials from Google Cloud Console

google-drive._setup: Requires OAuth 2.0 setup via Google Cloud Console

mcpServers._comment_git: Git operations - commit, branch, merge, status

git._note: Enhanced git operations beyond basic bash commands

mcpServers._comment_fetch: HTTP requests with caching and rate limiting

fetch._note: Alternative to WebFetch tool with more control

aws-kb._note: Query AWS Knowledge Bases powered by Bedrock

my-custom-server._note: Example of running a custom MCP server you've built

my-api-server._note: Example of connecting to a remote MCP server via SSE

my-python-server._note: Example of running a Python MCP server

everything._warning: More powerful but less restricted than filesystem server

_documentation._overview: Model Context Protocol (MCP) servers extend Claude's capabilities

_environment_variables._note: Use ${VAR_NAME} syntax to reference environment variables
_environment_variables._security: NEVER commit secrets to git. Always use environment variables.
_environment_variables._setup: Create .env file or export variables in your shell

_tips: Start with official servers before building custom ones
Use filesystem server restricted to project directory only
Test MCP servers locally before deploying
Each server runs as a separate process
Servers can be enabled/disabled by commenting them out
Use descriptive names for custom servers
Consider security implications of each server

_quick_start.1_choose_servers: Uncomment the servers you want to use above
_quick_start.2_set_env_vars: Create .env file or export required environment variables
_quick_start.3_test: Run 'claude' and verify servers are loaded
_quick_start.4_customize: Add your own custom servers as needed
